tool.name: Filtering Input File by Keywords or Values
tool.description: Filter a file by keyworks or values
tool.command:
##echo $options.np.number_of_proteins > $output1 python /projet/galaxydev/galaxy/tools/proteore_uc1/filter_kw_val/filter4.py -i "$input1" -o "$output1" -m "$options_keyword.match" --trash_file "$trash_file"
## Protein IDs #if $options_keyword.pi.protein_IDs != "None" #if $options_keyword.pi.protein_IDs == "text" --protein_IDs "$options_keyword.pi.txt" "$options_keyword.pi.prot_ids_ncol" #else if $options_keyword.pi.protein_IDs == "file" --protein_IDs_file "$options_keyword.pi.file" "$options_keyword.pi.prot_ids_ncol" #end if #end if
## Protein names #if $options_keyword.pn.protein_names != "None" #if $options_keyword.pn.protein_names == "text" --protein_names "$options_keyword.pn.txt" "$options_keyword.pn.prot_names_ncol" #else if $options_keyword.pn.protein_names == "file" --protein_names_file "$options_keyword.pn.file" "$options_keyword.pn.prot_names_ncol" #end if #end if
## Gene names #if $options_keyword.gn.gene_names != "None" #if $options_keyword.gn.gene_names == "text" --gene_names "$options_keyword.gn.txt" "$options_keyword.gn.gene_names_ncol" #else if $options_keyword.gn.gene_names == "file" --gene_names_file "$options_keyword.gn.file" "$options_keyword.gn.gene_names_ncol" #end if #end if
#* FASTA headers #if $options_keyword.fh.fasta_headers == "text" --fasta_headers "$options_keyword.fh.txt" #else --fasta_headers_file "$options_keyword.fh.file" #end if*#
## Number of proteins #if $options_value.np.number_of_proteins != "None" --number_of_proteins #if $options_value.np.number_of_proteins == "Equal" $options_value.np.equal "$options_value.np.nprot_ncol" "=" #else if $options_value.np.number_of_proteins == "Higher" $options_value.np.higher "$options_value.np.nprot_ncol" ">" #else if $options_value.np.number_of_proteins == "Equal or higher" $options_value.np.equal_higher "$options_value.np.nprot_ncol" ">=" #else if $options_value.np.number_of_proteins == "Lower" $options_value.np.lower "$options_value.np.nprot_ncol" "<" #else $options_value.np.equal_lower "$options_value.np.nprot_ncol" "<=" #end if #end if
## Peptides #if $options_value.pep.peptides != "None" --peptides #if $options_value.pep.peptides == "Equal" $options_value.pep.equal "$options_value.pep.pep_ncol" "=" #else if $options_value.pep.peptides == "Higher" $options_value.pep.higher "$options_value.pep.pep_ncol" ">" #else if $options_value.pep.peptides == "Equal or higher" $options_value.pep.equal_higher "$options_value.pep.pep_ncol" ">=" #else if $options_value.pep.peptides == "Lower" $options_value.pep.lower "$options_value.pep.pep_ncol" "<" #else $options_value.pep.equal_lower "$options_value.pep.pep_ncol" "<=" #end if #end if
## Q-value #if $options_value.qval.q_value != "None" --q_value #if $options_value.qval.q_value == "Equal" $options_value.qval.equal "$options_value.qval.qval_ncol" "=" #else if $options_value.qval.q_value == "Higher" $options_value.qval.higher "$options_value.qval.qval_ncol" ">" #else if $options_value.qval.q_value == "Equal or higher" $options_value.qval.equal_higher "$options_value.qval.qval_ncol" ">=" #else if $options_value.qval.q_value == "Lower" $options_value.qval.lower "$options_value.qval.qval_ncol" "<" #else $options_value.qval.equal_lower "$options_value.qval.qval_ncol" "<=" #end if #end if
## Score #if $options_value.score.score != "None" --score #if $options_value.score.score == "Equal" $options_value.score.equal "$options_value.score.score_ncol" "=" #else if $options_value.score.score == "Higher" $options_value.score.higher "$options_value.score.score_ncol" ">" #else if $options_value.score.score == "Equal or higher" $options_value.score.equal_higher "$options_value.score.score_ncol" ">=" #else if $options_value.score.score == "Lower" $options_value.score.lower "$options_value.score.score_ncol" "<" #else $options_value.score.equal_lower "$options_value.score.score_ncol" "<=" #end if #end if
## Intensity #if $options_value.intensity.intensity != "None" --intensity #if $options_value.intensity.intensity == "Equal" $options_value.intensity.equal "$options_value.intensity.inten_ncol" "=" #else if $options_value.intensity.intensity == "Higher" $options_value.intensity.higher "$options_value.intensity.inten_ncol" ">" #else if $options_value.intensity.intensity == "Equal or higher" $options_value.intensity.equal_higher "$options_value.intensity.inten_ncol" ">=" #else if $options_value.intensity.intensity == "Lower" $options_value.intensity.lower "$options_value.intensity.inten_ncol" "<" #else $options_value.intensity.equal_lower "$options_value.intensity.inten_ncol" "<=" #end if #end if
## iBAQ/iBAQ ratio #if $options_value.iBAQ.iBAQ != "None" --iBAQ
#if $options_value.iBAQ.iBAQ == "Equal" $options_value.iBAQ.equal "$options_value.iBAQ.iBAQcolumn" "=" #else if $options_value.iBAQ.iBAQ == "Higher" $options_value.iBAQ.higher "$options_value.iBAQ.iBAQcolumn" ">" #else if $options_value.iBAQ.iBAQ == "Equal or higher" $options_value.iBAQ.equal_higher "$options_value.iBAQ.iBAQcolumn" ">=" #else if $options_value.iBAQ.iBAQ == "Lower" $options_value.iBAQ.lower "$options_value.iBAQ.iBAQcolumn" "<" #else $options_value.iBAQ.equal_lower "$options_value.iBAQ.iBAQcolumn" "<=" #end if #end if ##echo $options.protein_IDs | tr ":" ";" >> $output1

tool.help:
This tool allows you to filter a file that contains different information of proteins (for example, the output of MaxQuant software).
**For each row, if there are more than one protein IDs/protein names/gene names, only the first one will be considered in the output**
1. Filter the file by keywords. You can choose to use one or more options. For each options, you can fill in the field or upload a file which contains the keywords.
**Keywords can be case-insensitive**
**"Exact match" option:**
- If you choose **Yes**, only the fields that contains exactly the same content will be removed.
- If you choose **No**, all the fields containing the keyword will be removed.
For example:
Exact match for "kinase": only lines which have exactly "kinase" is removed.
Unexact match for "kinase": not only lines which have "kinase" but also lines which have "alpha-kinase" and so on are removed.
If you choose to fill in the field, the keywords should be separated by ":", for example:
A8K2U0:Q5TA79:O43175
In other case, you can choose a file in text format in which each lines is a keyword, for example:
A8K2U0
Q5TA79
O43175
**The line that contains these keywords will be eliminated from input file.**
2. Filter the file by values. You can choose to use one or more options.
For each options, you can choose between "=", ">", ">=", "<" and "<=", then enter the value to filter and specify the column to apply that option.
**Available options** * **By keywords:**
--protein_IDs Protein IDs to filter --protein_names Protein names to filter --gene_names Gene names to filter
* **By values:**
--peptides Peptides to filter --iBAQ iBAQ/iBAQ ratio value to filter --number_of_proteins Number of proteins to filter --intensity Intensity value to filter --q_value Q-value to filter --score Score value to filter
**Output**
The tool will produce 2 output files.
* A text file containing the filtered input file.
* A text file containing the rows that were removed from input file.
